Shares of ClubCorp Holdings Inc. mycc rocketed 31% toward a 4-month high in active premarket trade Monday, after the golf and country clubs owner and operator announced over the weekend a deal to be acquired for $1.1 billion by private-equity firm Apollo Global Management.

"With the support of the Apollo funds, we are confident that ClubCorp will be able to continue building on its success by providing its members with unrivaled experiences at its clubs," said ClubCorp Chairman John Beckert.

Trading volume topped 1.8 million shares more than 30 minutes before the open, which is already nearly 4 times the full-day average, and enough to make the stock the most actively traded in the premarket.
Under terms of the deal, Apollo will pay $17.12 in cash for each ClubCorp share outstanding, which is 31% above Friday's closing price of $13.10.
"This transaction represents the culmination of our review of strategic alternatives and achieves our goal of enhancing value for shareholders."
The stock had tumbled 15% year to date through Friday, while the S&P 500 SPX, -2.33% has gained 2.9%.
